scripts/init.json.message:
I am a personal therapy chatbot designed to help you:
  • understand PTSD symptoms
  • develop solutions for your concern, and
  • assist you to make positive and lasting changes in your life
Please choose a dialogue option below to proceed:

scripts/test.json.message: Please select one of the following test cases:

scripts/persona1/activities.json.message: Would you like to work on something?

scripts/persona1/end-conversation.json.message: Looking forward to talking to you soon.

scripts/persona1/menu.json.message: Would you like to work on something?

scripts/persona1/start-conversation.json.message: I want to know you better so I have some questions.
Your answers will help me to better understand you.
Let‚Äôs now check up on some experience that you might face, shall we?

scripts/persona1/welcome.json.message:
I will support your journey to self-manage PTSD. For example, I can help you to:
  • understand PTSD symptoms
  • help you come up with strategies for managing symptoms, and
  • assist you to make positive and lasting changes in your life

scripts/persona2/activities.json.message: Would you like to work on something?

scripts/persona2/end-conversation.json.message: No problem. Talk to you laterüåàüëã

scripts/persona2/menu.json.message: Would you like to work on something?

scripts/persona2/start-conversation.json.message: I want to know you better so I have some questions!
Your answers will help me to better understand you. üòÅ
Let‚Äôs now check up on some experience that you might face, ready to your first question?

scripts/persona2/welcome.json.message:
I will support your journey to self-manage PTSD. For example, I can help you to:
  • understand PTSD symptoms
  • help you come up with strategies for managing symptoms, and
  • assist you to make positive and lasting changes in your life

scripts/TEST/original/end.json.message: These symptoms can last for a month or more and can be bothersome.
It can lead to problems in social and family life, work, and school.
I have some other tools that you might be interested in.

options: Tell me about the first symptom

scripts/TEST/test1/end.json.message: These symptoms can last for a month or more and can be bothersome.
It can lead to problems in social and family life, work, and school.
I have some other tools that you might be interested in.

options: Tell me about the first symptom

scripts/TEST/test2/end.json.message: I have some other tools that you might be interested in.

scripts/TEST/test2/init.json.message:
PTSD includes 4 types of symptoms:
  1. re-experiencing or reliving the trauma
  2. persistent avoidance
  3. negative thoughts and moods, and
  4. feeling more on-edge and reactive
Do you want to learn more about these symptoms?

scripts/TEST/test2/pick-symptom.json.message: Which symptom do you want to learn more about?

scripts/persona1/daily-check/bad.json.message: I am sorry to hear that.
To reduce your symptom, I can suggest multiple functions.
I strongly recommend you talk to your health provider. I have some resources for you to find professional help.

scripts/persona1/daily-check/bad2.json.message: Other than that, I have some coping tools that might help you manage your symptoms. Would you like to try?

scripts/persona1/daily-check/good.json.message: I have some resources for you to learn about PTSD. Would you like to try?

scripts/persona1/daily-check/init.json.message: I would like to ask you about your current level of distress. This will help me to adapt my recommendations.

scripts/persona1/daily-check/other-tools.message: I have some other tools that might help you.

scripts/persona1/daily-check/score.json.message: Thank you for answering the questions!

scripts/persona1/daily-check/survey.json.message: 1. How much do you agree with this statement that I can sleep well?
2. How much do you agree with this statement that I feel anger often?
3. How much do you agree with this statement that I feel worried or anxious often?
4. How much do you agree with this statement that I feel sad or hopeless often?
5. How much do you agree with this statement that I am disconnected from reality?
6. How much do you agree with this statement that I am disconnected from people?
7. How much do you agree with this statement that I remember trauma often?

scripts/persona1/daily-check/tool-list.j.message: Which tool do you want to try?

scripts/persona1/get-support/immediate.j.message: You can can call these numbers to get support.
I can also help you to find a VA location or in-network community care provider near you. Would you like to try?

scripts/persona1/get-support/other-tools.message: I have some other tools that might help you.

scripts/persona1/get-support/professiona.message: To learn more about treatment, visit the National Center for PTSD website.
In the website, you can find the location of treatment.
The National Center for PTSD Website: find local locations
I have some other tools that might help you. Would you like to try?

scripts/persona1/get-support/tool-list.j.message: Which tool do you want to try?

scripts/persona1/learn-more/choice.json.message: Which of the following topics do you want to know more about?

scripts/persona1/learn-more/init.json.message: Post traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) is caused by witnessing, experiencing, or learning about someone close to you who experienced traumatic events.
It might be actual or threatened death, serious injury, or sexual violence.
Which of the following topics do you want to know more about?

scripts/persona1/learn-more/other-tools..message: I have some other tools that might help you.

scripts/persona1/learn-more/repeat.json.message: Do you want to know about PTSD more?

scripts/persona1/learn-more/tool-list.js.message: Which tool do you want to try?

scripts/persona1/manage-symptoms/feel-ba.message: I am sorry to hear that.
Do you want to cope with other symptoms?
Then, how about trying other tools?

scripts/persona1/manage-symptoms/feel-go.message: I have some other tools that might help you. Would you like to try?

scripts/persona1/manage-symptoms/init.js.message: I can help you to manage different states. Which of the following describes you the best?

scripts/persona1/manage-symptoms/tool-li.message: I can manage your symptom in four different ways. Which options do you want to try?

scripts/persona1/take-assessment/have_he.message: People see therapy for many reasons, but almost everyone does so to relieve some kind of pain. It‚Äôs completely normal.
I encourage you to meet our health provider.
Other than that, I have some coping resources that might help you manage your symptoms. Would you like to try?

scripts/persona1/take-assessment/high.js.message: Your score puts you in the high range, which means that you have some PTSD symptoms.
I strongly recommend you talk to your health provider. Do you have yours?

scripts/persona1/take-assessment/high2.j.message: I have some resources for you to find professional help.
People see therapy for many reasons, but almost everyone does so to relieve some kind of pain. It‚Äôs completely normal üòä

scripts/persona1/take-assessment/high3.j.message: Other than that, I have some coping resources that might help you manage your symptoms. Would you like to try?

scripts/persona1/take-assessment/later.j.message: I have some resources for you to learn about PTSD. Would you like to try?

scripts/persona1/take-assessment/low.jso.message: Happy to hear that you are feeling good!
However, people who experience trauma can have this kind of reaction, at least for the first few weeks or months after the trauma.
I have some resources for you to learn about PTSD just in case. Would you like to take a look?

scripts/persona1/take-assessment/score.j.message: Thank you for answering the questions!

scripts/persona1/take-assessment/survey..message: 1. In the past month, do you have repeated, disturbing memories, thoughts, or images of a stressful experience?
2. In the past month, do you have repeated, disturbing dreams of a stressful experience?
3. In the past month, are you suddenly feeling or acting as if the stressful experience were actually happening again (as if you were actually back there reliving it)?
4. In the past month, do you feel very upset when something reminded you of a stressful experience?
5. In the past month, do you have strong physical reactions when something reminded you of the stressful experience (for example, heart pounding, trouble breathing, sweating)?
You have completed 25% already!
6. In the past month, do you avoid memories, thoughts, or feelings related to the stressful experience?
7. In the past month, do you avoid external reminders of the stressful experience (for example, people, places, conversations, activities, objects, or situations)?
8. In the past month, do you have trouble remembering important parts of a stressful experience?

9. In the past month, do you have strong negative beliefs about yourself, other people, or the world (for example, having thoughts such as: I am bad, there is something seriously wrong with me, no one can be trusted, the world is completely dangerous)?
10. In the past month, do you blame yourself or someone else for the stressful experience or what happened after it?
You are half-way through.
11. In the past month, do you have strong negative feelings such as fear, horror, anger, guilt, or shame?
12. In the past month, do you lose interest in activities that you used to enjoy?
13. In the past month, do you feel distant or cut off from other people?
14. In the past month, do you have trouble experiencing positive feelings (for example, being unable to feel happiness or have loving feelings for people close to you)?
15. In the past month, do you have irritable behavior, angry outbursts, or acting aggressively?
You have completed 75%!
16. In the past month, do you take too many risks or doing things that could cause you harm?
17. In the past month, are you 'super alert' or watchful on guard?
18. In the past month, do you feel jumpy or easily startled?
19. In the past month, do you have difficulty concentrating?
20. In the past month, do you have trouble falling or staying asleep?

scripts/persona1/track-progress/init.jso.message: Here is your previous assessment history.
I have some tools that might help you. Would you like to try?

scripts/persona1/track-progress/tool-lis.message: Which tool do you want to try?

scripts/TEST/original/examples/first.jso.message:
If someone is under re-experiencing or reliving the trauma, they might experience:
  • disturbing memories
  • nightmares
  • feeling or acting like the trauma is happening again
  • becoming very upset when reminded of the trauma.
options: Ok. Tell me about the second symptom

scripts/TEST/original/examples/fourth.js.message:
If someone feel more on-edge and reactive, they might experience:
  • feeling on guard
  • being irritable or angry
  • trouble sleeping
  • startling easily
options: I am done with learning 4 types of symptoms

scripts/TEST/original/examples/second.js.message:
If someone shows persistent avoidance, they might experience:
  • avoiding places
  • people or conversations that remind you of the trauma
  • avoiding thoughts, feelings, or memories closely associated with traumatic events
options: Ok. Tell me about the third symptom

scripts/TEST/original/examples/third.jso.message:
If someone feel negative thoughts and moods, they might experience:
  • feeling detached or isolating from others
  • negative beliefs
  • self-blame for the trauma
  • trouble feeling positive emotions like happiness and love
options: Ok. Tell me about the fourth symptom

scripts/TEST/original/intro/first.json.message:
The first symptom of PTSD is
re-experiencing or reliving the trauma
Would you like to see some examples?

scripts/TEST/original/intro/fourth.json.message: Fourth symptom is feeling more on-edge and reactive
Do you want to know more about indicators of this symptom?

scripts/TEST/original/intro/second.json.message: The second symptom of PTSD is persistent avoidance
Do you want to know more about indicators of this symptom?

scripts/TEST/original/intro/third.json.message: Third symptom is negative thoughts and moods
Do you want to learn more about negative thoughts and moods?

scripts/TEST/test1/intro/first.json.message:
The first symptom of PTSD is
re-experiencing or reliving the trauma

If someone is under re-experiencing or reliving the trauma, they might experience:
  • disturbing memories
  • nightmares
  • feeling or acting like the trauma is happening again
  • becoming very upset when reminded of the trauma.
options: Ok. Tell me about the second symptom

scripts/TEST/test1/intro/fourth.json.message: Fourth symptom is feeling more on-edge and reactive

If someone feel more on-edge and reactive, they might experience:
  • feeling on guard
  • being irritable or angry
  • trouble sleeping
  • startling easily
options: I am done with learning 4 types of symptoms

scripts/TEST/test1/intro/second.json.message: The second symptom of PTSD is persistent avoidance

If someone shows persistent avoidance, they might experience:
  • avoiding places
  • people or conversations that remind you of the trauma
  • avoiding thoughts, feelings, or memories closely associated with traumatic events
options: Ok. Tell me about the third symptom

scripts/TEST/test1/intro/third.json.message: Third symptom is negative thoughts and moods

If someone feel negative thoughts and moods, they might experience:
  • feeling detached or isolating from others
  • negative beliefs
  • self-blame for the trauma
  • trouble feeling positive emotions like happiness and love
options: Ok. Tell me about the fourth symptom

scripts/persona1/learn-more/facts/01-cor.message: Over 600,000 Veterans who used Veterans Affair services as recently as 2016 were diagnosed with PTSD.
Do you know how many service members were estimated to have PTSD after deployment out of every 100?

scripts/persona1/learn-more/facts/01-no..message: It‚Äôs okay! I will help you to know more about PTSD.
Can you take a guess how many veterans are diagnosed with PTSD in a year?

scripts/persona1/learn-more/facts/01-wro.message: Good guess! But there is significantly more...
Over 600,000 Veterans who used Veterans Affair services as recently as 2016 were diagnosed with PTSD.
Do you know how many service members were estimated to have PTSD after deployment out of every 100?

scripts/persona1/learn-more/facts/01-yes.message: Can you take a guess how many veterans are diagnosed with PTSD in a year?

scripts/persona1/learn-more/facts/02-cor.message: 5 out of every 100 active duty Service Members were estimated to have PTSD after deployment.
For those in infantry units that experienced combat, 13 out of every 100 Service Members had PTSD.
Don‚Äôt be afraid to seek out help and support to help you deal with any stress you‚Äôre experiencing.
Do you want to know about PTSD more?

scripts/persona1/learn-more/facts/02-wro.message: Good guess! But there is significantly more...

For those in infantry units that experienced combat, 13 out of every 100 Service Members had PTSD.
Don‚Äôt be afraid to seek out help and support to help you deal with any stress you‚Äôre experiencing.
Now that you've learned about the prevalence of PTSD, would you like to learn about more about related symptoms?

scripts/persona1/manage-symptoms/perspec.message: Repeat this phrase to yourself for 10 times:
It‚Äôs not always like this. There are times I have felt pretty amazing, too.
It‚Äôs not always like this. There are times I have felt pretty amazing, too.
options: I want to try another thought

I know that I deserve love.
I know that I deserve love.
options: I want to try another thought

scripts/persona1/manage-symptoms/perspec.message: Repeat this phrase to yourself for 10 times:
One night of poor sleep is not the end of the world.
Do you feel better?
This tossing and turning at night will pass.
I am sorry to hear that.
Do you want to cope with other symptoms?
Then, how about trying other tools?
Great!

scripts/persona2/learn-more/symptoms/end.message: These symptoms can last for a month or more and can be bothersome.
It can lead to problems in social and family life, work, and school.
I have some other tools that you might be interested in.

scripts/persona2/learn-more/symptoms/ini.message:
PTSD includes 4 types of symptoms:
  1. re-experiencing or reliving the trauma
  2. persistent avoidance
  3. negative thoughts and moods, and
  4. feeling more on-edge and reactive
Do you want to learn more about these symptoms?

scripts/persona1/learn-more/symptoms/exa.message:
If someone is under re-experiencing or reliving the trauma, they might experience:
  • disturbing memories
  • nightmares
  • feeling or acting like the trauma is happening again
  • becoming very upset when reminded of the trauma.
options: Ok. Tell me about the second symptom

scripts/persona1/learn-more/symptoms/exa.message:
If someone feel more on-edge and reactive, they might experience:
  • feeling on guard
  • being irritable or angry
  • trouble sleeping
  • startling easily
options: I am done with learning 4 types of symptoms

scripts/persona1/learn-more/symptoms/exa.message:
If someone shows persistent avoidance, they might experience:
  • avoiding places
  • people or conversations that remind you of the trauma
  • avoiding thoughts, feelings, or memories closely associated with traumatic events
options: Ok. Tell me about the third symptom

scripts/persona1/learn-more/symptoms/exa.message:
If someone feel negative thoughts and moods, they might experience:
  • feeling detached or isolating from others
  • negative beliefs
  • self-blame for the trauma
  • trouble feeling positive emotions like happiness and love
options: Ok. Tell me about the fourth symptom

scripts/persona1/learn-more/symptoms/int.message:
The first symptom of PTSD is
re-experiencing or reliving the trauma.

If someone is under re-experiencing or reliving the trauma, they might experience:
  • disturbing memories
  • nightmares
  • feeling or acting like the trauma is happening again
  • becoming very upset when reminded of the trauma.
Do you want to learn more about any other symptoms?
Fourth symptom is feeling more on-edge and reactive.

If someone feel more on-edge and reactive, they might experience:
  • feeling on guard
  • being irritable or angry
  • trouble sleeping
  • startling easily
Do you want to learn more about any other symptoms?
The second symptom of PTSD is persistent avoidance.

If someone shows persistent avoidance, they might experience:
  • avoiding places
  • people or conversations that remind you of the trauma
  • avoiding thoughts, feelings, or memories closely associated with traumatic events
Do you want to learn more about any other symptoms?
Third symptom is negative thoughts and moods.

If someone feel negative thoughts and moods, they might experience:
  • feeling detached or isolating from others
  • negative beliefs
  • self-blame for the trauma
  • trouble feeling positive emotions like happiness and love
Do you want to learn more about any other symptoms?
